content:
Yes, sure.  Here are some interesting facts about the Ripon City Hall building:

1. The Ripon City Hall building was designed by architect William Waters and completed in 1901. It was constructed of locally sourced Cream City brick, which was a popular building material at the time.

2. The building was originally designed with a basement that housed a jail, but it was never used for that purpose as it was deemed inadequate for housing prisoners.

3. The second floor of the building originally served as a public hall for community events and meetings. It has also been used as a dance hall, movie theater, and basketball court.

4. In 1934, a third story was added to the building to provide additional office space.

5. The building's clock tower contains four clocks, one facing each direction, which are still functional today.

6. The building has undergone several renovations over the years, including a major restoration in 2016 to modernize the building and improve accessibility.

7. The Ripon City Hall building has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since 1977, recognizing its architectural and historical significance to the community.

I hope you find these facts interesting!
